alerts.headline: squall watch in effect
alerts.description:
Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 40 knots and hail.

A few rounds of thunderstorms are possible this afternoon and early evening. Hail up to 3 cm in diameter is possible in addition to the squalls.

###

Large hail can damage vessels and cause injury.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Mariners are advised to prepare for potential squalls. Vulnerable vessels are most at risk and should seek safe harbour if underway.

alerts.headline: severe thunderstorm watch in effect
alerts.description:
Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain.

What:
Wind gusts to 90 km/h.
Hail up to 3 cm in diameter.

When:
This afternoon and early evening.

Additional information:
A few rounds of thunderstorms are possible today, with a threat that some of them may become severe. Torrential downpours are also possible with these thunderstorms.

###

Local utility outages are possible. Damage to roofs, fences, branches or soft shelters is possible.

Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms capable of producing damaging hail, wind or rain.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

For more information: https://www.ontario.ca/page/be-prepared-emergency.
alerts.instruction:
When thunder roars, go indoors! Lightning kills and injures Canadians every year.

Emergency Management Ontario recommends that you take cover immediately if threatening weather approaches.

affected_areas.area_description: St. Catharines - Grimsby - Northern Niagara Region
Niagara Falls - Welland - Southern Niagara Region

alerts.headline: squall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Squalls with wind gusts up to 40 knots and hail up to 3 centimetres are expected or occurring in the area.

Clusters of thunderstorms will cross western Lake Erie, moving to the northeast at roughly 40 knots.

###

Large hail can damage vessels and cause injury.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Mariners are advised to prepare for squalls. If underway, seek safe harbour immediately.
